metadata.title: CVE-2023-32258 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing of SMB2_LOGOFFand SMB2_CLOSE commands. The issue results from the lack of proper lockingwhen performing operations on an object. An attacker can leverage thisvulnerability to execute code in the context of the kernel.
